name: styled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
style
style verb [T]
(DESIGN)
to shape or design something such as a person's hair or an object like a piece of clothing or furniture or a book, especially so that it looks attractive: You've had your hair styled - it really suits you. This range of jackets is styled to look good whatever the occasion.
More examplesFewer examplesI think they could style her hair in a more flattering way.Her hair was styled to look like a 50s movie star.

style verb [T]
(TITLE)
to give a title to a person or group: [ + noun ] She styles herself "Doctor" but she doesn't have a degree. See also
self-styled usually disapproving
